qas.question: In what year did John Deacon join Queen?
What did Freddie from Queen change his last name to?
What song inspired Freddie from Queen's surname?
On what date did Queen play their first show?

context: The band had a number of <a0_0>bass<a0_0/> players during this period who did not fit with the band's chemistry. It was not until February <a1_0>1971<a1_0/> that they settled on John Deacon and began to rehearse for their first album. They recorded four of their own songs, "Liar", "Keep Yourself Alive", "The Night Comes Down" and "Jesus", for a demo tape; no record companies were interested. It was also around this time Freddie changed his surname to "<a2_0>Mercury<a2_0/>", inspired by the line "Mother Mercury, look what they've done to me" in the song "<a3_0>My Fairy King<a3_0/>". On <a4_0>2 July 1971<a4_0/>, Queen played their first show in the classic line-up of Mercury, May, Taylor and Deacon at a Surrey college outside London.
